sdp_rule.name: OS Type
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_BIT,$OS_NAM,$OS_VER var ($OS_LVS) = command('oslevel -s') call setHcveVariable('$OS_LVS') call setHcveResult(check(uc($OS_NAM),\ 'AIX',concat(uc($OS_NAM),' ',$OS_LVS,' ',$OS_BIT,'-bit'),\ 'Non-AIX system')) var $BOOK = 'Oracle Applications Installation Guide: Using Rapid Install \ Release 11i (11.5.10.2)' var $NOTE = 'Knowledge Article 316806.1' call setHcveVariable('$BOOK','$NOTE')
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule retrieves the operating system (OS) name, version, technology level, service pack, and bit of your system when you work on AIX system.

sdp_rule.name: OS Certified?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the correct version of AIX for installing the application tier of an Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i (11.5.10.2). Correct versions for the installation of the application tier are IBM AIX 5L (5.2 and 5.3) and IBM AIX 6 (6.1).

sdp_actions.sdp_action: No action is required.
!!SHOWSTOPPER!! You do not have IBM AIX, or not a correct version of IBM AIX installed on your server.

sdp_rule.name: Got Software Tools?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the required assembly tools for the installation of application tier of the Oracle E-Business suite Release 11i (11.5.10.2) exist.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: All required assembly tools for the installation of the application tier of the Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i (11.5.10.2) were found. No action required.

You do not have some of the required assembly tools for the installation of the Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i (11.5.10.2) installed. Check ${'BOOK} and install the tools before starting the installation. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |ArNotFound|``ar`` is not found in ``PATH``.| |CcNotFound|``cc`` is not found in ``PATH``.| |LdNotFound|``ld`` is not found in ``PATH``.| |MakeNotFound|``make`` is not found in ``PATH``| |ArElsewhere|``ar`` is not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required.| |CcElsewhere|``cc`` is not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required.| |LdElsewhere|``ld`` is not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required.| |MakeElsewhere|``make`` is not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required.|

sdp_rule.name: Got linkxlC?

sdp_dependency.value: Not on an adequate AIX system

sdp_dependencies.sdp_dependency: This rule applies for adequate AIX Operating Systems only.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the right versions of the linkxlC utilities are installed. This can be done by installing the XL C/C++ utilities package (xlcpp.util.8.0.0 or later) or by installing the full XL C/C++ Enterprise Edition V8.0 (vacpp.cmp.rte.8.0.0 or later).

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The linkxlC utilities are installed. No action required.

Either the ``linkxlC`` is not installed or the version of linkxlC is not correct. Check ${NOTE} for the right version of the linkxlC utilty. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |... found|An incorrect version of the package (fileset) was found. Install the correct version.| |linkxlcNotFound|The linkxlC utilities are not installed. Check ``Knowledge Article 761569.1`` for the right linkxlC utility.| |NoAccess|The status and version of the linkxlC utility cannot be verified because the user has no execute permissions to the ``/bin/lslpp`` command. Provide the user with execute permissions.|

sdp_rule.name: IP Address
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule gets the host IP address.

sdp_rule.name: Domain Name
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule gets the host domain name.

sdp_rule.name: DNS Lookup

sdp_dependencies.sdp_dependency: This rule requires the IP address of the server.

sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $ip = "%A00400%" var $hst = field('\.',0,command('hostname')) call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(length($ip)),\ 'Cannot determine IP address',\ not(testFile('x','/usr/bin/nslookup')),\ 'Cannot access /usr/bin/nslookup',\ and(grepCommand(concat('/usr/bin/nslookup ',$hst),quote($ip),'f'),\ grepCommand(concat('/usr/bin/nslookup ',$ip),quote($hst),'f')),\ 'Host correctly registered in DNS',\ 'Host not correctly registered in DNS'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the host is registered correctly in the DNS.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The host is registered correctly in the DNS.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Host not correctly registered in DNS|Register the host.domain in the DNS.| |Cannot determine IP address|Fix any problem with the host IP address.| |Cannot access /usr/bin/nslookup|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/bin/nslookup`` to the current user.|

sdp_rule.name: /etc/hosts Format

sdp_dependencies.sdp_dependency: This rule requires the domain name of the server.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``/etc/hosts`` file contains a line with ``ip_address fully_qualified_domainname short_hostname``.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/hosts`` entry for the fully qualified domain name and host name is adequate.
Grant read permissions on ``/etc/hosts`` to the current user.

The fully qualified host name and host name are not configured correctly. Ensure that there is an IP address entry for the fully qualified domain name with the host name as one of the aliases. |*Return Value*|*Action"| |no entry found|No entry with the fully qualified domain name followed by the host name was found.| |no correct entry found|No entry beginning with an IP address with the fully qualified domain name followed by the host name was found.|

sdp_rule.name: Net Service Access?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the user who is logged in can create the ``/tmp/.oracle`` directory or can create files in it. The directory is used by the Net Service Listeners.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The user who is logged in can create the ``/tmp/.oracle`` directory or he can create files in the directory.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |NoDir|The ``/tmp/.oracle`` is not a directory. Remove the ``.oracle`` entry in ``/tmp``.| |PermNotOk|The user who is logged in cannot create files in the ``/tmp/.oracle`` directory. Grant read, write, and execute permissions on this directory to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_dependencies.sdp_dependency: You did not specify a valid application tier directory.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks if there is sufficient disk space to install the application tier of the Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i (11.5.10.2).

sdp_actions.sdp_action: There is sufficient disk space to install the application tier of the Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i (11.5.10.2) in the directory. No action is required.

sdp_rule.name: Space in tmp
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $tmp = nvl(getEnv('TMP'),getEnv('TMPDIR'),'/tmp') call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testDir('d',$tmp)), 'Cannot access tmp directory',\ expr('>=',get_df($tmp),1048576),'Available',\ 'Need at least 1GB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough temporary space. Initially Oracle Rapid Install (RI) checks the ``TMP`` and ``TMPDIR`` environment variables to locate the temporary directory. If these environment variables do not exist, then RI uses ``/tmp``. The minimum requirement is 1 GB.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough temporary space.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 1 GB|Increase the available temporary space to 1 GB or more. You can define ``TMP`` or ``TMPDIR`` to point to a directory with 1 GB available space.| |Cannot access tmp directory|Grant read, write, and execute permissions on ``/tmp`` or directories in ``TMP`` or ``TMPDIR`` to the user who is logged in.|
